@[everyone](everyone)

Announcement:
Ramadan Holiday Schedule & Important Updates

Hello everyone,

As Ramadan progresses, we understand that everyone is adjusting to the fasting schedule while staying busy with their commitments. At the same time, we want to ensure that everyone gets a well-deserved break for self-refreshment and reflection.

Holiday Schedule

Our last working day will be March 26, and we will resume on April 4. During this time:
	‚Ä¢	Coaches will not be available.
	‚Ä¢	Development work will be on hold.
	‚Ä¢	The team will be completely offline.

We encourage you to use this break to spend time with your friends and family. For those focused on learning, you can review previous modules, prepare for interviews, and revisit our past webinars, which cover essential topics. Take this time to gather your questions, so once we‚Äôre back, we can dive right in!

Updated Schedule After April 4

When we resume, the schedule will be adjusted:
	‚Ä¢	Night session: 10:00 PM Eastern Time
	‚Ä¢	Day session: Between 9:30 AM - 10:00 AM to 5:30 PM - 6:30 PM Eastern Time

These timings may be slightly adjusted as needed, as we usually do.

This is a quick heads-up about our upcoming holiday and festival schedule. Wishing you a peaceful and blessed Ramadan. Enjoy your time, and we look forward to seeing you back on April 4!

Best regards,
SAn

latestMessage.text:
# Understanding RTK Query in Redux Toolkit

RTK Query is a powerful data fetching and caching tool built into Redux Toolkit, designed to simplify API interaction in React applications. It provides features like automated caching, deduplication of requests, and state management for server data out of the box. By defining API endpoints in a centralized manner, developers can perform CRUD operations with minimal boilerplate. With its focus on declarative data fetching, RTK Query enables efficient state updates, reduces the need for manual Redux setup, and seamlessly integrates with Redux Toolkit's ecosystem. 

Learn more in the [RTK Query documentation](https://redux-toolkit.js.org/rtk-query/overview).

---

6760dd0a5fb515001adebcb8.text:
@[everyone](everyone) 

Mastering Interview Responses: A Proven Technique for Success

One of the key areas in interviews is ensuring that your answers are organic, make sense, and go beyond just definitions. I‚Äôve noticed that while students are actively working on hands-on projects and technical tasks, when it comes to answering interview questions, many revert to textbook definitions rather than providing real-world insights.

To address this, I am introducing a technique that you should practice over the next couple of months. This will help you frame your responses effectively.

Technique for Better Interview Answers
	1.	Ask Precise Questions ‚Äì Instead of generic inquiries, formulate specific, technical questions from a user perspective. For example, in an AI-powered chat portal, you might ask:
‚ÄúGive me an example of DOM manipulation on an e-commerce seller portal from a product perspective.‚Äù
	2.	Analyze & Document on Google AI Responses ‚Äì Once the AI provides an answer, read it multiple times, document the insights, and refine your understanding.
	3.	Collaborate & Review ‚Äì Share your documented responses in your crowd, for review and feedback.
	4.	Practice Speaking Aloud ‚Äì Once the response is refined, practice saying it out loud to make your delivery natural and confident.

By following this method, I think, +- 90% of the common interview response issues can be resolved. This approach is effective for both technical and behavioral questions and should be integrated into your daily practice.

I will demonstrate this technique in our next webinar, showing one or two examples so you can see how it works in action. With consistent practice, this will become second nature in your communication and professional discussions.

I‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts‚Äîdo you think this approach will help? Or do you have a better method to share?

#InterviewSuccess #TechnicalSkills #CommunicationMastery #CareerGrowth

Thank you!

@[everyone](everyone) Let‚Äôs all take a moment to celebrate Kashem for successfully obtaining his Product Owner Certification! Over the past two weeks, he has dedicated immense time and effort to achieving this milestone.

This certification marks the final step in preparing for the job market as a Product Owner. It means mastering the requirements, excelling in interviews, and demonstrating strong practical skills. Kashem now has in-depth knowledge of how we do things, ensuring that everything he‚Äôs learned is second nature to him.

Congratulations, Kashem! You‚Äôve done an incredible job, and the next chapter looks very promising. Well done, and best of luck with what‚Äôs ahead!
